page.title: 16Cotswold Edge (2)
page.content: Around Painswick and Gloucester there was the Civil War between the Cavaliers and the Roundheads.It was said that King Charles stayed at the Court House.There are also bullet holes in the front door.The Cavaliers attacked the Roundheads in the church and you can find more bullet holes in the walls and fire-damaged tombs. Bellringers had a lucky escape when the spire of the church was struck by lightning in 1883 and crashed down. These bells are famous among ringers. The Clipping Service on Feast Sunday in mid-September has nothing to do with the yew trees."Clipping" means "Embracing".The children dance round the church and eat "Puppy-dog Pie". Robert Raikes the founder of Sunday Schools,said "The feast would have disgraced a heathen"
